reviews.review_msg: Prof Dasovic was great. He does his best to convey stats to social sciences students and is sure to pepper a lot of dad jokes into his lectures! The course content is difficult and the workload is heavy - but he does his best to make sure everyone gets it. He's very available outside of class and more than happy to help if you're having any trouble

I loved having him as a professor. He is super understanding and really cares about his students, he will go out of his way to ensure everyone knows what is going on and will alter exams/midterms if the class needs it. He is super quick to respond to emails and questions. If you put in a smidgen of effort, you will do well in his class.

Although this course was a little on the more difficult side, Professor Dasovic tried his best to make stats understandable for those who werent as well versed. His lectures were well organized and detailed; he even went out of his way to assist students through email or by sending out helpful resources! Overall great Professor

Joseph was an amazing professor!I was skeptical of taking this course with him after reading the reviews, but I am glad I still decided to!Although the course content was difficult to grasp, he tried his best to make sure we understood! I suggest coming to class, since class and lab attendance amounts to 1/4th of your grade (which helps A LOT!).

Have a better attitude that's not "I don't need to learn this so I won't bother" and you'll do fine. Tough grader, but the material is tough so it makes sense. Prof is SUPER available outside of class, so if you get on top of what you don't understand early it will be fine.

Using test averages is not a good reflection of the course overall. Lecture outlines were very detailed, assignments were difficult but mostly straightforward if you attended tutorial; Josip was very often available for office hours and helpful if you had specific questions; TA Alex was also helpful in tutorial. Not too bad of a class if you worked

Do not take him as a prof. Extremely disorganized and all over the place. The final was 30%, the paper was 10%, and an assignment worth 5% all in the last week of the semester. No communication with his students after the final either. The average for the final exam was 58%........

Yes 50 percent of grade was due in last two weeks but final exam was 35, paper 10 (which people had approximately 1 month to work on ) and 5 hwk (hwk25) Marking was very fair, lectures imperitive. mid-term and final heavily lecture based but notes very detailed. Josip presents stats in intuitive way. Made you work for an A; IT's UNI THOUGH RIGHT??

NO knowledge on HOW to teach what he knows. Had an R assignment analytic paper & the final all due within the same week. To sum it up, 50% of our mark due in the last week of the semester. Stops communicating & neglects students towards the end of semester when half of their grade is on the line. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Tough marker, HEAVY course load

Seems knowledgeable on the course content if you go to office hours but doesn't communicate expectations very clearly. Midterm average was below 50 (without the curve) and he only gave us the study guide for the final 2 days in advance. HW assignments took very long but average on them wasn't bad. Overall okay but don't take with more than 9 cred.
